body_html:
@malcolmreynolds Thanks for the response. We probably should have noted that we knew of the workaround - but it still feels like bad behaviour because it's not at all obvious in a large network where the offending op comes from. This is acerbated by networks that already contain custom ops which also need to be imported previously (obviously).

Sounds good that there are plans to make this happen more seamlessly and I agree that improved documentation would go a long way to helping with this.

body:
@malcolmreynolds Thanks for the response. We probably should have noted that we knew of the workaround - but it still feels like bad behaviour because it's not at all obvious in a large network where the offending op comes from. This is acerbated by networks that already contain custom ops which also need to be imported previously (obviously).

Sounds good that there are plans to make this happen more seamlessly and I agree that improved documentation would go a long way to helping with this.
